title.narrative: F.a: Ensuring Forest Regeneration + Livelihood Security through FRA

description.narrative: The current project is a continuation of Siemenpuu?s funded 13019AAS project, and with this at large wants to see to the implementation of the Forest Rights Act (FRA) in the 45 target villages (15 villages in Bhanupratpur teshshil, 15 villages in Pandariya and 15 villages in Bodla tehshils of Kabirdham district of Chhattisgarh). In the context of FRA, the project will follow up through grassroots level support, advocacy and media efforts on the CFR and tenurial security (IFR) applications which have been s ubmitted earlier, including also submitting left out CFR + IFR claims and submitting the re-application of those claims which either have been rejected or have been given legal land titles (pattas) for much less land then actually claimed for. Another comp onent of work under FRA will be to secure management rights over forest and forest resources (filling forms). In this same context, AMS also wants to see to the securing of housing rights and the increasing of productive capacity of the land for which land legal papers have been secured. ASM will furthermore put efforts towards awareness building and advocacy on the importance of biodiversity promotion and protection, which includes the development of nurseries of trees and herbs. Another component of ASM ?s work under this project is the strengthening of the Vaidya Mahasangh-Network of Traditional Medical practitioners with an aim of protecting and conserving traditional knowledge and the preservation of cheaper and readily available treatment options. AMS interventions also concern capacity building of community members on rights + entitlements in the context of pro poor schemes.
